description: map borders from 1630s-1835 to come, with revisions up to 1854
Doolittle's 1795 map matches the modern county outline, except for Marlborough
Hartford county as it appeared in Warren's 1811 map (borders from 1835 to be revised)
Bloomfield incorporated from Windsor, Farmington, and Simsbury in 1835-1843
Rocky Hill incorporated from Wethersfield in 1843
South Windsor incorporated from East Windsor in 1845
New Britain incorporated from Berlin in 1850
West Hartford incorporated from Hartford, and Windsor Locks incorporated from Windsor, in 1854
Hartford county as it appeared in Woodford's 1855 map
East Granby incorporated from Granby and Windsor Locks in 1858
The towns of Hartford County as they have existed from 1871 to the present
